text:
Hi,

When I try to install the apache server using the following command. I am 
getting an eerror:

D:\Java\Apache\Apache2\bin>apache -k start
[Thu May 22 01:41:02 2003] [error] (OS 2)The system cannot find the file specifi
ed.  : No installed service named "Apache2".

When I try to start the apache server using the following command. I am getting 
an eerror:
D:\Java\Apache\Apache2\bin>apache -k install
[Thu May 22 01:41:37 2003] [crit] (OS 10038)Socket operation on non-socket: make
_sock: for address 127.0.0.1:8080, apr_socket_opt_set: (SO_KEEPALIVE)
no listening sockets available, shutting down
Unable to open logs


When I try to run the server in console mode then I get the following error:
D:\Java\Apache\Apache2\bin>apache
[Thu May 22 01:42:09 2003] [crit] (OS 10038)Socket operation on non-socket: make
_sock: for address 127.0.0.1:8080, apr_socket_opt_set: (SO_KEEPALIVE)
no listening sockets available, shutting down
Unable to open logs


I am using windows ME. Please let me knwo if you need any further information.

Regards,
Alok
creator: alokhmishra@yahoo.com

text: Windows 98/ME are not supported platforms for Apache 2
creator: chip@force-elite.com

text:
still the same..
[Tue Dec 12 17:02:09 2006] [crit] (OS 10038)Socket operation on non-socket:
make_sock: for address 0.0.0.0:80, apr_socket_opt_set: (SO_KEEPALIVE)
no listening sockets available, shutting down
Unable to open logs
-------
Apache2.2.3
creator: temujin.kali@gmail.com

text:
1. bugzilla is not a support forum, ask a user to user peer support forum.
   The answer is documented hundreds of times there.

2. bug is in your windows socket drivers, probably an antivirus, vpn or even
   antispyware or spyware application.

3. ME is dead to Microsoft, so it's dead to us.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
